org.activerdf.wrapper.sesame2
Class WrapperForSesame2

java.lang.Object
  org.activerdf.wrapper.sesame2.WrapperForSesame2

public class WrapperForSesame2
extends java.lang.Object

construct a wrapper for a sesame2 repository. many sesame2 classes use an initialize method, which clashes with the ruby naming requirement, to name the constructor initialize. Because of this it is currently not possible to construct such objects from jruby but instead embarrsing wrappers, such as this have to be used. check http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JRUBY-45 to see if bug still exists.

Constructor Summary
WrapperForSesame2()
          the constructor. it does nothing.

Constructor Detail

WrapperForSesame2

public WrapperForSesame2()
the constructor. it does nothing. all the real work has to be done by the callConstrcutor methods, because JRuby currently cant manage custom class loaders _and_ constructors with arguments.. yes, its sad.

Method Detail

callConstructor

public org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryConnection callConstructor(java.io.File file,
                                                                   boolean inferencing)
construct a wrapper for a sesame2 repository. many sesame2 classes use an initialize method, which clashes with the ruby naming requirement, to name the constructor initialize. Because of this it is currently not possible to construct such objects from jruby but instead embarrsing wrappers, such as this have to be used. check http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JRUBY-45 to see if bug still exists.

Parameters:
file - - if given a sesame2 the file will be used for persistance and loaded if already existing
inferencing - - if given, the sesame2 repository will use rdfs inferencing
Returns:
the sesame connection of the sesame repository associated with this wrapper.

callConstructor

public org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryConnection callConstructor()
construct a wrapper for a sesame2 repository. many sesame2 classes use an initialize method, which clashes with the ruby naming requirement, to name the constructor initialize. Because of this it is currently not possible to construct such objects from jruby but instead embarrsing wrappers, such as this have to be used. check http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JRUBY-45 to see if bug still exists. Uses in memory repository and rdfs inferencing.

Returns:
the sesame connection of the sesame repository associated with this wrapper.

callConstructor

public org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryConnection callConstructor(boolean inferencing)
construct a wrapper for a sesame2 repository. many sesame2 classes use an initialize method, which clashes with the ruby naming requirement, to name the constructor initialize. Because of this it is currently not possible to construct such objects from jruby but instead embarrsing wrappers, such as this have to be used. check http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JRUBY-45 to see if bug still exists. Uses in memory repository.

Parameters:
inferencing - - if given, the sesame2 repository will use rdfs inferencing
Returns:
the sesame connection of the sesame repository associated with this wrapper.

callConstructor

public org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryConnection callConstructor(java.io.File file)
construct a wrapper for a sesame2 repository. many sesame2 classes use an initialize method, which clashes with the ruby naming requirement, to name the constructor initialize. Because of this it is currently not possible to construct such objects from jruby but instead embarrsing wrappers, such as this have to be used. check http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JRUBY-45 to see if bug still exists. Uses rdfs inferencing.

Parameters:
file - if given a sesame2 NativeStore using this directory will be constructed
Returns:
the sesame connection of the sesame repository associated with this wrapper.

getSesameConnection

public org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryConnection getSesameConnection()
Returns:
the sesame connection of the sesame repository associated with this wrapper.

load

public boolean load(java.lang.String file,
                    java.lang.String baseUri,
                    org.openrdf.rio.RDFFormat dataFormat,
                    org.openrdf.model.Resource context)
load data from file

Parameters:
file - A file containing RDF data
baseUri - The base URI to resolve any relative URIs that are in the data against. This defaults to the value of file.toURI() if the value is set to null
dataFormat - The serialization format of the data.
context - The contexts to add the data to. Note that this parameter is a vararg and as such is optional. If no contexts are specified, the data is added to any context specified in the actual data file, or if the data contains no context, it is added without context. If one or more contexts are specified the data is added to these contexts, ignoring any context information in the data itself.
Returns:
boolean

dump

public java.lang.String dump(org.openrdf.model.Resource context)
Exports all explicit statements in the specified contexts to the supplied RDFHandler

Parameters:
context - The context(s) to get the data from. Note that this parameter is a vararg and as such is optional. If no contexts are supplied the method operates on the entire repository.
Returns:
string

size

public long size(org.openrdf.model.Resource context)
Returns the number of (explicit) statements that are in the specified contexts in this repository.

Parameters:
context - The context(s) to get the data from. Note that this parameter is a vararg and as such is optional. If no contexts are supplied the method operates on the entire repository.
Returns:
long

clear

public boolean clear(org.openrdf.model.Resource context)
Removes all statements from a specific contexts in the repository.

Parameters:
context - The context(s) to remove the data from. Note that this parameter is a vararg and as such is optional. If no contexts are supplied the method operates on the entire repository.
Returns:
boolean

add

public boolean add(org.openrdf.model.Resource subject,
                   org.openrdf.model.URI predicate,
                   org.openrdf.model.URI object,
                   org.openrdf.model.Resource context)
Adds a statement with the specified subject, predicate and object to this repository, optionally to one or more named contexts.

Parameters:
subject - The statement's subject.
predicate - The statement's predicate.
object - The statement's object.
context - The contexts to add the data to. Note that this parameter is a vararg and as such is optional. If no contexts are specified, the data is added to any context specified in the actual data file, or if the data contains no context, it is added without context. If one or more contexts are specified the data is added to these contexts, ignoring any context information in the data itself.
Returns:
boolean

add

public boolean add(org.openrdf.model.Resource subject,
                   org.openrdf.model.URI predicate,
                   org.openrdf.model.Literal object,
                   org.openrdf.model.Resource context)
Adds a statement with the specified subject, predicate and object to this repository, optionally to one or more named contexts.

Parameters:
subject - The statement's subject.
predicate - The statement's predicate.
object - The statement's object.
context - The contexts to add the data to. Note that this parameter is a vararg and as such is optional. If no contexts are specified, the data is added to any context specified in the actual data file, or if the data contains no context, it is added without context. If one or more contexts are specified the data is added to these contexts, ignoring any context information in the data itself.
Returns:
boolean

remove

public boolean remove(org.openrdf.model.Resource subject,
                      org.openrdf.model.URI predicate,
                      org.openrdf.model.URI object,
                      org.openrdf.model.Resource context)
Removes the statement(s) with the specified subject, predicate and object from the repository, optionally restricted to the specified contexts.

Parameters:
subject - The statement's subject, or null for a wildcard.
predicate - The statement's predicate, or null for a wildcard.
object - The statement's object, or null for a wildcard.
context - The context(s) to remove the data from. Note that this parameter is a vararg and as such is optional. If no contexts are supplied the method operates on the entire repository.
Returns:
boolean

remove

public boolean remove(org.openrdf.model.Resource subject,
                      org.openrdf.model.URI predicate,
                      org.openrdf.model.Literal object,
                      org.openrdf.model.Resource context)
Removes the statement(s) with the specified subject, predicate and object from the repository, optionally restricted to the specified contexts.

Parameters:
subject - The statement's subject, or null for a wildcard.
predicate - The statement's predicate, or null for a wildcard.
object - The statement's object, or null for a wildcard.
context - The context(s) to remove the data from. Note that this parameter is a vararg and as such is optional. If no contexts are supplied the method operates on the entire repository.
Returns:
boolean

query

public org.openrdf.query.TupleQueryResult query(org.openrdf.query.QueryLanguage queryLanguage,
                                                java.lang.String query)
Execute a query

Parameters:
queryLanguage - The query language in which the query is formulated. The value can be SERQL, SERQO or SPARQL.
query - The query string.
Returns:
TupleQueryResult A representation of a variable-binding query result as a sequence of BindingSet objects. Each query result consists of zero or more solutions, each of which represents a single query solution as a set of bindings. Note: take care to always close a TupleQueryResult after use to free any resources it keeps hold of.
